greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least k >= 0 such that (2*n-1)*2^k - 1 or (2*n-1)*2^k + 1 is prime, or -1 if no such value exists.
link: Arkadiusz Wesolowski, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Brier Number
example: For n=4, 7*2^0-1 and 7*2^0+1 are composite, but 7*2^1-1=13 is prime, so a(4)=1.
mathematica: Table[n = 2*n - 1; k = 0; While[! PrimeQ[n*2^k - 1] && ! PrimeQ[n*2^k + 1], k++]; k, {n, 100}] (* _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Sep 04 2011 *)
results.author: _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Aug 31 2011
